tweets.text:
Eely good news with river temperatures picking up towards 12¬∞C #Eels are on the move.
These were caught as part of the monitoring at one of our gauging station pumped passes in #Gloucestershire - looks like it‚Äôs working üëçüèª  @SEGandrewK @EnvAgencyMids @robleedavies @severnrivers https://t.co/e2gjRx37Gv

Bearing in mind that the 30-minute peak in the previous monitoring exercise was 44.5, it‚Äôs clear my constituents are being subjected to a major and ongoing environmental incident.

I trust the culprits will be properly held accountable by @EnvAgencyMids.

@carlsayerUCL @N_Rivers_Trust @NorfolkNNSI @AnglianWater @bcatchment @RiverWensum @nfkconservation @NorfolkBiod @NorfolkNats @NorfolkBIS @EnvAgencyAnglia @NENorfolkSufflk At the top of the Wensum catchment it's abundant in Dereham (Wending Beck), has had some control in previous years but hitting it hard there would be well worth it!

Published regarding Extinguish the forest fire in #Dhenkanal in leading newspaper  @PragativadiNews Thank you so much team Pragativadi  for your encouragement. 

@MonaLisaBal3 @jyotsnadevi33  @HindolPalace   @susantananda3 @Wildlife_Film @Sudhir_Dkl @DfoDhenkanal @PCCFWL_Odisha https://t.co/3L2FulNN6y

A real waste and a shame to see perfectly good condition @EnvAgency plant being towed from Sunbury to Erith for scrapping - lots more yet to come down this week too :(

photo: chiswick pictorial https://t.co/TIHWX96g16

This ITV report is as shocking as yesterday‚Äôs news from the @EnvAgency . This is the death of an iconic river in slow motion - largely due to unmitigated agricultural pollution. The intensive poultry industry needs to clean itself up ASAP for starters @thenoblefoods https://t.co/d1pmbc1Fug

Self-reporting by water companies = abject failure and river habitats are paying the price. It‚Äôs time for the @EnvAgency to carry out its regulatory duties to the full. Every sewage spill increases profit - the system was destined to fail @Dunne4Ludlow https://t.co/0BMh4zjZDz

We‚Äôre at the end of the peatland restoration season. Recently we have been working to improve water quality and biodiversity on Shap Fells in Cumbria - here's our team in action
 @cumbriawildlife @unitedutilities @EnvAgency https://t.co/GSxdN7fZCY
@StaffordshireCC @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids Caused my 94 year old mum to have sore eyes and that was before Christmas. Awful. Can‚Äôt believe you think that‚Äôs ok.

tweets.text: @StaffordshireCC @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids Come on people of Newcastle under Lyme, suck it up, it only STINKs to high heaven and gives you a headache, sore throat and stinging eyes!üí™üèªit only stinks inside your home day and night,it‚Äôs only short term health problems if nothing at all!!üñïüèª

@StaffordshireCC @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids Let's just say that if somebody was piping hydrogen sulphide into your offices and homes every day, you wouldn't be playing it down in this way. You'd do something.

@sunnyraisin62 @StaffordshireCC @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids Hope you asked for a re banding to a cell with no windows or garden, we shouldn't be paying  to live like this, woken  4.23 am couple o days ago, no windows or doors open & once it's in you can't get the retched stench out, #stopthestink #capitoff

@StaffordshireCC @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids After reading this I am ashamed to have paid my council tax today. I live 2 miles from the landfill. To tell me to close my windows and wait for the odour to clear before opening them again is an insult. This  odour enters my home as I sleep at night, windows & doors shut.

@StinkStopthe TOMORROW WE PROTEST - STOP THE STINK FROM RED INDUSTRIES @redindustries2 @redindustries3 AND MAKE THE INEPT @EnvAgency LISTEN TO THE PEOPLE WHO LIVE WITH THIS VILE SITE ON THEIR DOORSTEP. #stopthestink https://t.co/IHIbFZ2R6p
@EnvAgencyYNE @SYFR Are there any health issues being caused by the smoke as my parents live local?

@Penmcgregor We shouldn't be policing #HS2 Penny. They were granted a social licence to build this rail but it's obvious now that it was based on empty promises. @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency  should be keeping them in check yet they are sanctioning the destruction. Time to have our say!

Officers from @EnvAgencyYNE are continuing to work with @SYFR at a #fire in Burngreave, #Sheffield. We‚Äôre providing specialist advice on water management to help protect the #environment. Residents are urged to follow the advice of emergency services. https://t.co/UAoeUAMkUO

Another night when thousands of houses get gassed @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency What punishment should @RedIndustries2  have for gassing a community? This can't be allowed to continue.

@Smudger_47 @NewsNBC @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe It‚Äôs everywhere...sickening,destroying Newcastle under lyme, as well as the lives and health of many... #protectandsurvive New guidance coming out 1970‚Äôs style for us all - we have had the nuclear winter and get ready now for the nuclear summer #stopthestink ‚òÆÔ∏è https://t.co/LGMkBvkXNV

We are grateful that our council is stepping up to take action against @RedIndustries2 & has spoken up about the @EnvAgency ‚Äòs woeful handling of the situation in the last to @MPGeorgeEustice Look forward to hearing next steps @SimonTagg @StinkStopthe https://t.co/RB61XYW64c

Newcastle under Lyme residents calling the @EnvAgency between 2&4:30am last night as the smell was so bad they couldn‚Äôt sleep! This is an atrocious quality of life & how are they expected to work today? Time for change @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe

New lockdown goal: compete the London #GreenchainWalk‚Äôs üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Today took us to the #ThamesBarrier up to beautiful Charlton and Oxleas Meadows for beautiful views over the cityüåªüçÉüå≥ü¶ú #EasterWeekend 

Do the walks yourself here: https://t.co/iaOy5McX1O https://t.co/kyvSVO7Wzf

tweets.text:
Could we be doing more to build a world that values, rather than suppresses, differences?

The @EnvAgency's @AyoSokale, highlights that we say we want #diversity, when in fact we create all systems for a fictional ‚Äònormal‚Äô person.

üëâhttps://t.co/s1Wg8787Sa

#AutismAwarenessDay

BBC News reports 403,000 recorded pollution incidents where water companies allowed raw sewage to enter UK waterways during 2020. 

I am absolutely speechless....

#farming #food #environment @ bbcnews @EnvAgency

This is happening even without the impact of EDF Sizewell C's 10+ metres sea wall. No wonder Suffolk residents are alarmed EDF won't disclose design of sea wall & EDF believe it's ok to only protect their own site disregarding impact on neighbours 
@PINSgov @EnvAgency @The_ONR https://t.co/FX6CvLkfu7

urls.title: Event duration monitoring ‚Äì lifting the lid on storm overflows
urls.description: On today's blog we look into the 2020 Event Duration Monitoring Data, which is fundamental to understanding and improving the environment.¬†

tweets.text:
Storm overflows performance data to inland and coastal waters has been published for all water companies in England.

For information on storm overflows and a link to the full data and a summary of the key statistics, read our blog post: https://t.co/51zRnT2fSi https://t.co/cLtFlAR7jt

This letter üëáis v welcome, thanks @mayorofhackney & also @colin_gram @HMUG_Hackney @DobbyWoods @plasticfreehkny & all who've helped bring attention to #plasticpollution #sewage on the #riverlea. We look forward to an effective response from @EnvAgency 1/9 https://t.co/adszfR3hl7

@SimonTagg @SianieRoo @StinkStopthe resort after two years of engagement, meetings with NIEA and the operator. Your case is a mirror image to ours. The agencies will promise moon and stars but nothing will be done unless legal action commences. Residents here are also bringing their own action seperate from BCC

The data has been tricky to interpret, and our Data & Evidence team have been working overtime to make this happen... but we are SO pleased to announce that our updated #SewageMap will be released next week ü•≥ 

#EndSewagePollution #TogetherForRivers https://t.co/daq3OGdOgG

@MrMarkwarren1 @StinkStopthe @SianieRoo @DrMickSalt @EnvAgency had to buy one of those sort of silver foil loft covers with a zip for the loft hatch as it was seeping through anywhere it could find. This house is literally sealed up like nobody‚Äôs business and it still manages to come through. Not as much as before it‚Äôs very light but still

This is a very good point. When the gas comes overnight it becomes trapped in the home & we breathe it in all night. It‚Äôs still outside in the morning so can‚Äôt release it. Could our homes have higher levels of hydrogen sulphide than outside @DrMickSalt ? @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency https://t.co/eRjR7yZnmt

tweets.text: Disturbed that in 2020 to see a high level of 59 sewage discharge into the @RiverChess but concerned that the @EnvAgency may be under reporting the figures. In addition the Environment Agency seemed to have forgotten to mention that 52 of these spills were un-permitted.
@CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency Doesn‚Äôt look like they were happy about it. Good. They should be made to spend a day clearing up other peoples crap. https://t.co/0mJBTpxNMw

M6 J12 to J13 a eagle eyed @HighwaysWMIDS who was monitoring the CCTV cameras notice the occupants of a Passat dumping rubbish in a ERA bay.  We intercepted the vehicle M6 J14 to J15 and escorted them back clear their rubbish up.  Details passed to @EnvAgency. 5419 https://t.co/5tWwYYiaDZ

@SianieRoo @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency Temporarily, yes, on average, no. Indoors creates an overall protection factor, but in temporary circumstances, it can act as a reservoir if the outside concentration drops suddenly.
